document_title: Acute sinusitis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Symptoms of acute sinusitis are also symptoms of general sinusitis, including:
Purulent discharge from anterior nose;; Purulent or discolored postnasal drip;; Stuffy or congested nose;; Decreased or lost odor;; Stuffy nose;; Facial pain;; Fever (for acute sinusitis only).
Minor symptoms include:
Headache;; Earache or feeling of fullness in the ear;; Halitosis;; Toothache;; Cough;; Fever (for subacute or chronic sinusitis);; Tired.
Among them, signs of acute sinusitis are more specific with the following manifestations:
Symptoms last more than 10 days;; High fever (over 39 degrees Celsius or 40.2 degrees Celsius) with nasal discharge or facial pain lasting 3-4 consecutive days;; Symptoms become severe within the first 10 days.

Symptoms of acute sinusitis are also symptoms of general sinusitis, including:

Minor symptoms include:

Among them, signs of acute sinusitis are more specific with the following manifestations:
